name: Alambre
description: Alambre is a popular Mexican dish consisting of grilled beef topped with chopped bacon, bell peppers, onions, cheese, salsa and, in some variations, avocado.

name: Beef ball
description: Beef ball is a commonly cooked food in Canton and overseas Chinese communities which was originated by Teochew people.

name: Bistek
description: Beef sirloin or tenderloin, salt and pepper. Regional variations may include onions, garlic, oregano, cumin, calamansi juice, soy sauce.

name: Carne asada
description: Carne asada is a dish of grilled and sliced beef, usually skirt steak, sirloin steak, tenderloin steak, or rib steak.

name: Galbi
description: Galbi is a type of gui (grilled dish) in Korean cuisine. Galbi is the Korean word for rib and the dish is usually made with beef short ribs.

name: Mitsado
description: Mitsado (or mechado) is a braised beef dish originating from the Philippines inspired by culinary methods of Spain, which it was a former colony of.
